align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2117536"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2117536#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2116894" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2116894" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VanHessen1234"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081240"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="VanHessen1234" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Armaf/Club-de-Nuit-Intense-27656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Club de Nuit Intense"title="Club de Nuit Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2116894ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2116894" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081240">VanHessen1234</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-07">04/07/24 01:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful and elegant white flower scent! Opens up with white flowers and settles nicely on my skin. Smells well blended and balanced. I would buy this for a summer holliday. It reminds me of visiting flower gardens in Europe when the mornings are still cool but the days are warm.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2116894"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2116894#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2113546" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2113546" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Orbit1965"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2063390"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2063390.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Orbit1965" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Michael-Kors/Michael-2416.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2416.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Michael"title="Michael"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2113546ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2113546" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2063390">Orbit1965</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-03">04/03/24 19:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Boring.  I much prefer Michael by Michael Kors for my tuberose blast, which feels fresh, young and sexy to me.  Bloom is more grandma pretty, to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2113546"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2113546#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2098552" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2098552" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kingofclubs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1822609"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1822609.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kingofclubs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Under-The-Lemon-Tree-53379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Under The Lemon Tree"title="Under The Lemon Tree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2098552ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2098552" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1822609">Kingofclubs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-20">03/20/24 12:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are 2 different fragramces this reminds me of. Maison Margiela flower market and/or Armani Rouge Malachite. FYI the Armani is significantly stronger and longer lasting, the MM flower market a more natural take on the scent of the florists.<br />
But, this is undeniably a beautiful scent, and has about the ideal strength and projection for a wedding ceremony. I tip my head to those who have written about wearing this for their wedding day. Its perfect for thr occassion... I'd kiss your hands on bended knee to show my apreciation for tou elegant taste.<br />
As mentioned elsewhere, if you are not a fan of tuberose - beware. This may not be to your liking. In perfumery the white florals of jasmine, orange blosson amd tuberose are rightly lauded as the 3 queens, but as a caveat, tuberose isnt as easy on the nose as the other two. Its not as divisive as full on rose, or orchid say, but now amd again i meet people who arent fans. <br />
Its good, but there are similar scents do it even better. But a queen on her wedding day shouldnt be making eyes water feom ten feet, so this gets my vote for the most formal occasions. Also one spray is probably light enough for the office, so if you want a naturalish elegant floral, this could be for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2098552"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2098552#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2094126" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2094126" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Letmeregister"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1920970"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1920970.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Letmeregister" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2094126ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2094126" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1920970">Letmeregister</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-16">03/16/24 03:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried it numerous times and each time it smells like urine. Gucci bloom instense is really beautiful though, just get the instense version</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2094126"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2094126#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2093139" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2093139" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Forbiddenjade"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/359188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.359188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Forbiddenjade" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Prive-Vert-Malachite-34588.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34588.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Prive Vert Malachite"title="Armani Prive Vert Malachite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2093139ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2093139" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/359188">Forbiddenjade</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-15">03/15/24 03:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I too wore this on my wedding day, 5 years ago now. There's something endearing, almost nostalgic and dreamy about this white flowers composition. Somewhat, it screams rich and nonchalant about it, as almost all Gucci creations. It really lives up to the house DNA.<br />
 <br />
The opening has a prominent bubblegum note from the tuberose which subsided almost immediately on me, to make room for a really enchanting jasmine. <br />
I guess that the nostalgic note singing in my mind has to do more with the white flowers overall, than anything else. It's a romantic, tender concoction with a modern twist. I may be biased, as I love a good jasmine, but this is really classy, ethereal in that demure way that so well suits brides on their big day.<br />
If you love white flowers, give it a test. <br />
<br />
10/10 though longevity isn't great on me to be honest. The intense isn't as good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2093139"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2093139#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2093105" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; On a happier note, I adore the design of the bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2093105"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2093105#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2080802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2019780">Alenmarie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-22">02/22/24 13:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cheira a madame elegante, daquelas que não gosta de passar batida.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2068299" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mellybeans0"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1991191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1991191.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mellybeans0" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cirque-du-Soleil/L-eau-de-Parfum-92656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'eau de Parfum"title="L'eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2068299ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2068299" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1991191">Mellybeans0</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 09:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you’re a 100% floral person this is for you, but if you’re 99% or less a floral person, this may overwhelm you. The silage and lasting power is fantastic- but on me it smelled like a flower bouquet from the grocery store. It softens up a bit if you layer it with something more creamy or gourmand but the tuberose will still come through incredibly strong.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2068299"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2068299#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2061634" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2061634" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thaochipnd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579302.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thaochipnd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chloe/Jasminum-Sambac-57248.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57248.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasminum Sambac"title="Jasminum Sambac"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2061634ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2061634" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302">thaochipnd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-14">02/14/24 00:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like an English noble lady. Very strong, the scent of Tuberose is very realistic, as if holding a bouquet of Tuberose in your hand. This is love for me because I am a girl who loves White Flower scents so much. If you like Burberry London, Kim Kardashian EDP, Diptyque Doson, you should definitely try Gucci Bloom. They all belong to the luxurious and extremely elegant White Floral/Tuberose scent group, definitely the most beautiful fragrances for brides on their wedding day.<br />
<br />
Rating: 9/10. Every time I wear it, I think of a scene of a large castle surrounded by beautiful gardens</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2061634"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2061634#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2053929" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2053929" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toosimilar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1533225"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1533225.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="toosimilar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2053929ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2053929" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1533225">toosimilar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-06">02/06/24 10:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Heavy sweet tuberose with some jasmine, not to my liking, unfortunately<br />
But I believe the sillage may be pretty awesome!<br />
<br />
I got trapped because people compared it to YR Tendre Jasmin, but they are different<br />
Haven't tried Do Son, but it obviously has Narcotic Venus vibes (more banana like tuberose scent). This one is a tuberose-jasmine combo with animalic undertones in the dry down<br />
<br />
There are also similarities to Michael Kors Glam Jasmine</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2053929"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2053929#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2052289" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1875875">valolopez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-29">01/29/24 15:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I chose to wear Gucci Bloom on my wedding day because it is such a classic, classy, well-made white floral for a spring wedding. It never gets too soapy as other white florals tend to, and it has a slight powdery quality that is balanced by a creaminess to it that is just... delicious. It's such a pretty scent and brings so many fond memories. This is in constant rotation for me in the Spring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2046060"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2046060#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2039078" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701366">dinkleheit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-22">01/22/24 20:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have been on the hunt for a good floral perfume that smells classic, but not too outdated, and Gucci Bloom has hit the mark for just an elegant floral perfume. I think this has to be one of my new favorites. Should be obvious, but if you don't like floral notes, this isn't for you. I love that there is no element of sweetness to it, just a pure floral perfume.The projection is good and it's just overall a classy beautiful girl perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2039078"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2039078#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2035829" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2035829" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nobrainer22tx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884564"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.884564.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nobrainer22tx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/The-One-698.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.698.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The One"title="The One"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2035829ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2035829" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/884564">Nobrainer22tx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-19">01/19/24 12:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’m learning that I don’t live white florals. I don’t hate them, they don’t smell bad, I just don’t want to smell like a bouquet of flowers &amp; nothing more. I always thought tuberose had a rose scent &amp; I like rose but I’m discovering that it does not. At all. The name is tricking me! I think tuberose is the culprit in white florals that I’m not loving but I’m not certain. The die down so far isn’t too bad, it’s a little more of a powdery floral. I don’t smell anything remotely citrus as some other reviewers are getting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2035829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2035829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2035714" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1980082">Nadadalloul</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-19">01/19/24 10:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this perfume, it suits my personality, this is so flowery and soft, no sweet notes in there. Waiting to buy it again and again very soon</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2035714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2035714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2034043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14355">albatros</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 12:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@nichefrag I don't know which perfume u smelled but there are no citruses here at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2033803"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2033803#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033797" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nichefrag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1975804"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nichefrag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1975804">nichefrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 11:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me this is a rather light citrusy floral perfume. As someone who is not a fan of floral scents, I grew to like this perfume and the way it reacts with my skin. This is a linear perfume and is not complex which for me is neither good not bad. Don't think I would repruchase this as I would prefer a more complex fragrance. However, it was a good beginner perfume as this was the second perfume bottle I ever purchased.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2033797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2033797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2030562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2030562" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evavidal62"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="evavidal62" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Jasmin-Rouge-12765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasmin Rouge"title="Jasmin Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2030562ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2030562" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1917831">evavidal62</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-14">01/14/24 07:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have the fragrance and the body lotion and when both are applied after your shower or bath BAM! My kind of floral fragrance. I detect unlisted fruit notes but could be my own personal unique experience with this scent. Every fragrance 'reacts' differently to each skin type and person/wearer and always gonna smell different to everyone. I detect a little citrus and mango despite there being no such notes mentioned. There is a light fresh and lactonic creamy thing going on but it is most likely tuberose. This is a very tuberose forward scent. The tuberose is coming off as fruity and very juicy. It's not bubble gum tuberose but it does smell like a touch tropical fruity like a delicious smoothie. Smells bright and light yellow. I am also sensing a honeysuckle note. Smells like a little bush of white and yellow flowers (jasmine, tuberose, honeysuckle). Sweet flowers. The jasmine is also there and as a slightly citrusy white jasmine but it's mostly tuberose. The dry down stage comes rather quickly because this perfume to my nose doesn't last as long as I'd like and it lasts longer and is enhanced with the lotion. The dry part is hard to make out. Amber and something softly woody. I'm very sure the 3 notes in this note pyramid as seen on this page is not the only thing going on with this scent. But whatever it is it's gorgeous. It's fresh light and spring time in a bottle. It's feminine with a woman not girly vibe. You have to like white florals to get this scent. Good for wearing daily and or the work place/office. This is not making any kind of big statement. She is just asking you to be yourself as a woman every day as you go about your day. Very motherly scent too. Simple and elegant and very sweet floral perfume. Love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2030562"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2030562#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2030168" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's so elegant, gentle, floral... just perfect. I've had it for years, and would buy it again.<br />
However, its silage and longevity is pretty poor, but it's great for work and casual occasions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2026779"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2026779#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2022836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; For classy, mature, summer settings it is perfect. However it does have an "older" feel to it. Wouldn't wear it on a first date as a young girl, for example. I also think it works perfectly in warm-rain days.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2020649"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2020649#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2020407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2020407" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BalladsOfViolet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1930250"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1930250.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BalladsOfViolet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2020407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2020407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1930250">BalladsOfViolet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-04">01/04/24 15:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this was.. oh my god. my signature scent for my entire high school years. it is so calming, and I like the white flowers note, and I've got compliments from it. the only downside is poor longetivity... i don't see this perfume can "stand out" in cold seasons.<br />
<br />
a must-have if you like light floral scents!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2020407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2020407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2017909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1380900">stephm42120</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-02">01/02/24 11:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I haven’t been able to find a pure white floral scent that I adore like this one. Sleeping Beauty would wear this. I always received compliments when I wore her sister Gocce Di Fiori and they’re identical. I have a sample of the EDP and it’s beautiful for the spring and summer. It’s simple and classic. Anyone can wear this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2017909"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2017909#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2014744" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1910998">UlianaM</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-27">12/27/23 11:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know what Rangoon Creeper smells like, so to me it's more jasmine(60-65%) and tuberose (40-35%).<br />
I like it, but it's a strong scent. So I don't think I'd buy for me, but I like to smell it on somebody.<br />
Really good performance, 2 sprays is max for this kind of scent. Clean white florals. Classy. Intense.<br />
<br />
I like it, but I don't see anything special in it.<br />
<br />
Rainy spring day must be indeed perfect for it as @an_baum mentioned.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2012193"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2012193#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2012056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The recipe is simple and without seeing it, I would say it has more notes, then listed. However, for some reason it gives me headache every time I use it which makes me a little bit sad since it is not a cheapie and I would like to be able to use it more. The performance is really good on me I only spray it once or twice and it lasts almost the whole day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2010967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2010967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2009163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It gave off big grandma vibes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2009163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2009163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008173" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2008173" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mayvray"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1797175"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1797175.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mayvray" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Skin-35244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Skin"title="Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2008173ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2008173" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1797175">mayvray</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-22">12/22/23 14:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is SO beautiful. I wore this every day in grade 7 and 8. I frequently got told I smelled like a grandmother, but I didn’t even mind. This is a top 5 for me. I LOVE white florals. If you don’t, then steer clear. This is a very, very simple floral fragrance. But it’s so good. I could rave about this one forever.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2008173"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2008173#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2000262" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2000262" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clashingdreams"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1742365"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1742365.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="clashingdreams" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Naomi-Goodsir/Bois-d-Ascese-16582.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16582.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois d'Ascese"title="Bois d'Ascese"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2000262ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2000262" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1742365">clashingdreams</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-13">12/13/23 10:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I feel like this perfume is a bit misunderstood because not a lot of people understand what rangoon creeper smells like. I think this is why a lot of people here attribute the smell of white florals to be the dominant smell. I grew up in Southeast Asia so I saw this flower a lot. It's a vine with small white and red flowers and looks like jasmine but smells much more dewy like honeysuckle. <br />
<br />
When I was in primary school, a girl showed me how to drink the nectar of rangoon creepers by pulling the little stringy pollen bit out and sucking the flower from the stem. We weren't allowed to do it but it was incredibly mild and sweet. <br />
<br />
Gucci Bloom is like this, only modestly sweet and modestly floral, but incredibly dewy, especially when you first spray it. Rangoon creeper note is definitely dominant-it's the little buttery uptick that wafts at your nose a little at the very beginning. Honeysuckle. Dewy, Wetness, but not damp. It's like standing in a new drizzle in the late afternoon. Mildly floral, mildly sweet, a little dingy. Dingy the same way rainwater feels a bit unclean after you've been in the rain for a good minute. Do we have white florals? Yes of course. They are present and gives the perfume a little bit of body.<br />
<br />
I enjoy this perfume but I understand the complaints. It's indeed quite boring and linear, and also sadly overpriced. The performance is disappointing. It fades easily, and you would only smell it if you were touching the person. Definitely not worth the price, but worth sampling if you'd like to see how rangoon creeper smells like, or if you enjoy white florals with a dewy twist.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="2000262"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=2000262#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1991596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1991596" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MysteriousMidna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1725147"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1725147.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MysteriousMidna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Eclaire-93628.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.93628.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eclaire"title="Eclaire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1991596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1991596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1725147">MysteriousMidna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-03">12/03/23 14:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like how white American Smarties tablet candy tastes (or Rockets candy if you’re Canadian). You’ve really got to love tuberose to like this; this scent was how I realized I don’t like it. Dossier has a great dupe if you want to save some money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1991596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1991596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1984525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1984525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Yes Malena"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1380154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1380154.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Yes Malena" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bijan/Bijan-3555.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3555.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bijan"title="Bijan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1984525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1984525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1380154">Yes Malena</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-24">11/24/23 19:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>opens with sweet lily of the valley, changing to raw, rough, green jasmine and gardenia, warming to vanilla creamy something. not sure I'm getting tuberose but it is there somehow like a ghost. this fragrance has an aggressive stage which relents and I relent, wondering if it's maybe wearable after all... beautiful.<br />
earlier today I'd been wearing Gucci Rush and had no need for another perfume, but I had this sample of Bloom which I found on a wall in my neighborhood, along with Chanel Gabrielle Essence, while walking the dog.<br />
Thank you, perfume fairies, for the free trip.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1984525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1984525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1976722" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880377">lika_jakobia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-14">11/14/23 14:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am ok with floral sweet jasmine scent but for me it was too much.<br />
It is more tasty botanical next day.<br />
Opening note: 3+<br />
Sillage/Projection: 6+<br />
Dry down: 8+<br />
Longevity: 6+<br />

Do respect the perfumer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1976722"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1976722#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1975704" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; tuberose! padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1968650" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mademoiselle R&ecirc;ve"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1717004"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1717004.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mademoiselle R&ecirc;ve" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-55997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"title="Mon Guerlain Eau de Parfum Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1968650ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1968650" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1717004">Mademoiselle R&ecirc;ve</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-04">11/04/23 14:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Luxurious, opulent bouquet of white flowers.<br />
Creamy.<br />
Linear.<br />
Versatile - suitable for daytime/nighttime. Moderate longevity and sillage on me. <br />
I would see it as a good perfume for a summer wedding, either for the bride or for a guest...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1968650"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1968650#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I loved it beforehand and now I can't be around this or anything similar. I gave it to my mom and she appreciated it. I can't wear Calvin Klein Beauty either now because it brings me to the same place.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1963799"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1963799#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961737" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961737" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Claugregg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1439753"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1439753.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Claugregg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Jazz-Club-20541.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20541.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jazz Club"title="Jazz Club"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961737ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961737" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1439753">Claugregg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-26">10/26/23 18:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like an Hollywood actress from the 50's. Captivating and timeless floral scent, that holds genuine notes of tuberose and jasmine. Nothing too woody, too fresh, too gourmand, too sweet.... just good old flowers. I like it very much, but I find it too classic to own a full bottle of it. With that said, if you're on the lookout for a great white floral scent... pretty good!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1961737"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1961737#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1958801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1958801" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marienette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/161734"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="marienette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/La-Belle-Le-Parfum-65175.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65175.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Belle Le Parfum"title="La Belle Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1958801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1958801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/161734">marienette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-23">10/23/23 05:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm not into strong jasmine and tuberose scents. If  that's your thing, you'd probably enjoy it. Smells very old fashioned and stifling to my nose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1958801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1958801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1956994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
