align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1956994"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1956994#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1954790" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1954790" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="qianqian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778971"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1778971.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="qianqian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Heure-Bleue-Eau-de-Parfum-208.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.208.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Heure Bleue Eau de Parfum"title="L'Heure Bleue Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1954790ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1954790" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778971">qianqian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-18">10/18/23 03:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a lovely jasmine white floral frag. Now is the bloom season for star jasmines in Australia. I can smell them wasping in my yard. Very similar. I like the fresh, natualistc way it smells.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1954790"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1954790#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1954173" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1954173" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="francesco_grieco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1763409"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1763409.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="francesco_grieco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1954173ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1954173" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1763409">francesco_grieco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-17">10/17/23 08:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bloom by Gucci is a fragrance that pleasantly surprises by displaying a conceptual nature more commonly found in niche perfumery rather than designer fragrances. While it aims to encapsulate a bouquet of flowers, tuberose takes the spotlight for me. This tuberose is notably green and botanical, reminiscent of Do Son by Diptyque. However, it's worth noting that while both fragrances carry botanical elements, Do Son leans towards naturalism, almost photorealistic, whereas Bloom feels more dreamy, akin to botanical illustrations brought to life. What stands out is how Bloom encapsulates the essence of Gucci during Alessandro Michele's creative direction. If you appreciate tuberose, botanical scents, or admire Alessandro Michele's work, I would highly recommend giving this fragrance a try.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1954173"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1954173#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1949133" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1949133" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CustardBunny"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1861715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1861715.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CustardBunny" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44894.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci Bloom"title="Gucci Bloom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1949133ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1949133" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); The bottle is clean and elegant but the scents are just amazing. A little goes a long way and it smells so thick and lovely. It makes me happy, i first sprayed it on at nights out but more recently i wear it in the evenings just enjoying the scent for myself. its perfect youth</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1942402" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gonegirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1701528.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gonegirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1942402ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1942402" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701528">gonegirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-02">10/02/23 08:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smells nice and the bottle and box are pretty. but it's VERY simple and not very strong, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but makes it not worth the price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1942402"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1942402#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1939752" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1939752" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PeacefulSunshine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1676840"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1676840.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PeacefulSunshine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Rodriguez-for-Her-Eau-de-Parfum-14319.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14319.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Rodriguez for Her Eau de Parfum"title="Narciso Rodriguez for Her Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1939752ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1939752" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1676840">PeacefulSunshine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-28">09/28/23 17:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I totally dig this original Bloom EDP. I think it's a great blind buy since it's well made and smells elegant [due to the white florals] without going too much in any direction (it's not too sweet, not too cloying, not too fruity, etc.). <br />
<br />
It reminds me of the creaminess and soft texture of those wonderful flowers on Southern Magnolia trees. Or off-white linens hanging out to dry with a gentle breeze blowing through them on a pleasant sunny day.<br />
<br />
This scent is really nice. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1939752"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1939752#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1938061" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; prominent Jasmine scent, but even with its simplicity it's still very beautiful and elegant and the longevity is very good on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1937161" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eaudeghostie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1452964"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1452964.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eaudeghostie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83483.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Goddess"title="Goddess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1937161ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1937161" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1452964">eaudeghostie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-25">09/25/23 14:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This used to be my go-to scent, and it was what made me like white florals.  It came out when I was 17 and I remember wearing this in high school, so it's very nostalgic for me. This is powerful, do not play with it.  It's got a scent projection that rivals virtually anything I've ever used and it's eternal on the skin.  Nowadays, I prefer something more complex but it's a simple, strong scent and I still enjoy it occasionally.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1937161"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1937161#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1935947" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Nothing special or memorable about it. Good for casual use when you just like to smell fresh and girly, a pretty safe option for offices etc.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1935947"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1935947#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1928795" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1928795" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="onlygirlalive"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1737704"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1737704.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="onlygirlalive" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Tobacco-Vanille-1825.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1825.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco Vanille"title="Tobacco Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1928795ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1928795" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1737704">onlygirlalive</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-15">09/15/23 14:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I adored this years ago.. I can’t remember when I bought this, I’ve had the bottle forever and it’s unending. I remember using this in high school, spraying sparingly in the morning, and one spray in the middle of my neck before I slept, I just loved the scent that much. I think I used this the most when I was 17, which I now think is a very fitting age for this scent. It’s young, green, innocent, pretty and clean. Very, very slightly soapy. So slightly that I only realised it when I saw other people said that it is. To me, this is a true jasmine scent, which is what I love most about it. My mother told me that it smells exactly like the flowers of the jasmine tree in front of her childhood home. She used to spray this on her pillow before sleeping after I went off to college. <br />
<br />
When I wear it now I get tons of compliments, everyone loves a good, fresh jasmine after all. My professor stopped in class to ask me about it once, reminiscing about the blooming jasmine flowers in the springs of her childhood, how the streets were full of the smell. I use it with my plainest clothes, on my emptiest days. Almost doesn’t feel like a perfume, it’s like plucking a jasmine flower and rubbing it onto your neck.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1928795"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1928795#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1928197" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1924352" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lilah_lilah2023"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1767593"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1767593.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lilah_lilah2023" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1924352ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1924352" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1767593">Lilah_lilah2023</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-10">09/10/23 07:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Someone said that it smells like a European cemetery... I kind of agree. It smells like flowers in a church. Not in a bad way, I mean.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1924352"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1924352#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1922484" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1922484" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elleb03"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1414445"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1414445.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="elleb03" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1922484ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1922484" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1414445">elleb03</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-07">09/07/23 21:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There’s something sharp, yet creamy, classy, yet fun about this perfume. I am starting to open up to white florals, my first introduction being Kim Kardashian’s original perfume, and i adore that one. Gucci bloom is a beautiful perfume, there is no denying that. Even for white floral haters, this fragrance is beautiful. There’s something smokey about this as well, I think this fragrance can do it all. She can be with you when you wear a leather jacket, or when you wear a white dress. When you have a sweater on, or when you’re in a ballgown. When you’re happy, when you’re sad, when it’s raining, or when it’s sunny out. I think this fragrance can do it all, and is made for a woman/man/anyone who can do it all too. It’s growing on me, but for now i can’t declare this a love, i’m fairly new to white florals, and they’re not marketed towards my age group, so I still have much to learn, but for what it is, I am so far enjoying this. I really love the smoke quality this note has.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1922484"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1922484#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1920441" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1920441" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="los blancos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382752"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="los blancos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1920441ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1920441" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1382752">los blancos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-05">09/05/23 13:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume confuses me. One day I smell it, it has something a bit unique and on another day it’s quite generic. I think it’s quite overpriced nonetheless.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1920441"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1920441#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1919886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1919886" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cgaleb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753541"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1753541.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cgaleb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Miller-Harris/Feuilles-de-Tabac-4804.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4804.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Feuilles de Tabac"title="Feuilles de Tabac"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1919886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1919886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753541">cgaleb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-04">09/04/23 21:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This really does smell like real tuberose flowers. I know it’s not listed but I smell orange blossoms, too. I think the Jasmine helps to amp up the tuberose, but I don’t smell it much on its own. This is super pretty, but it’s almost too sweet and linear for me. Linear isn’t always bad but since it maintains its sweetness throughout its wear, I find myself overwhelmed by it. Fortunately, it’s not a beast performer, because this is one perfume I wouldn’t be able to smell for 8 hours straight, no matter how pretty it may be.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1919886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1919886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1917809" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/104121">ANNAFRYS</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-02">09/02/23 07:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me it smells like cementary. Especially in Poland when people take White lilies and put them on graves. Nope thanks. Its not for modern woman I cant imagine any woman to wear it and be happy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1917809"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1917809#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1917303" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1917303" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tilapia_johnson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504382"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="tilapia_johnson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1917303ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1917303" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504382">tilapia_johnson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-01">09/01/23 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I always return to the note of tuberose, hoping to find a fragrance that will do it justice. Gucci Bloom is simply tuberose, jasmine, and honeysuckle, tropical and vintage-feeling florals that are as sweet as they are lush. My favorite aspects of Lys 41 without the vanilla dry-down, or like Xinu's OroNardo but a touch watered down. The scent is strong but the longevity is poor, only a couple hours, so you can enjoy a bubble without having to be in it all day. Not very unisex (femme), and I say with hesitance it is more mature. Easy for a white floral lover who doesn't want indolic or skanky complexity to challenge others.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1917303"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1917303#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1915866" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1915866" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="supervanilla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826956"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826956.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="supervanilla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1915866ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1915866" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826956">supervanilla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-30">08/30/23 23:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a sweet vanilla-based girl and don't like florals, so I don't have too many scents to compare this to and lean away from it. That said, I grew up with jasmine flowers, gardenias, and tuberose in my garden because my grandmother loved them. This perfume captures those scents so well! It's a straightforward, plain white floral. More personally, it evokes nostalgia for those days with my grandma (accordingly, it smells like something my grandmother would wear!)<br />
<br />
I can see someone enjoying this scent and I can also see anyone wearing it, young or old! It can be sweet and chic. My memories and the perfume's lack of complexity make this older for me, as do some others in the reviews.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1915866"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1915866#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1907055" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1907055" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astrorocks"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1815219"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1815219.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astrorocks" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1907055ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1907055" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1815219">astrorocks</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-20">08/20/23 12:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really love this perfume and this is one of the easier reviews for me to write. This is pure tuberose and jasmine in the daytime. Just pure, unfiltered sweet white floral and little else here, but the imagery is strong for me. It reminds me of younger days (early 30s now). Spring time, childhood, green and white and fresh things. My hair is still golden, sun-bleached blonde and I'm in a powder blue and white sundress that matches the skies above me. There's fresh-washed sheets hanging on a nearby clothes-line and my grandmother's flower gardens are nearby. I'm probably counting clouds or something else whimsical. No worries - just bright and innocent happiness. In that there is a certain adult romanticism now that I enjoy. Yes, it is linear and, yes, it's minimalist. But sometimes I want that in my life. This world is too complicated and negative, anyway, and sometimes a long-lived and simple mood brightener is needed.<br />
<br />
On my skin, white florals work very well and pretty much always stay the exact same smell in the bottle, freshly on my skin, and after several hours of wear. This one lasts long and rubs off on my papillon if I carry him while wearing it, so quality IMO is high. It's an 8.5/10 solely because I can admit it lacks a certain emotional depth and I find, e.g., Sergie Lutens Fleurs d'Oranger (and others) does what this does emotionally, but slightly better. I still have a bottle and I still love it and it makes me innocently happy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1907055"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1907055#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903285" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1903285" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Frantheone"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577084"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1577084.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Frantheone" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Eau-Parfumee-au-The-Vert-144.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.144.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Parfumee au The Vert"title="Eau Parfumee au The Vert"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1903285ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1903285" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577084">Frantheone</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-16">08/16/23 01:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my go-to perfume for 5 years and I still reach for it sometimes. The reason I chose it at the time was tuberose,  I'll always appreciate the romance and elegance it evokes. <br />
With the experience of 5 years with this fragrance I would like to state the following:<br />
1. Yes, it might be linear but a minimalist will absolutely appreciate it, since being that simple it allows every note to sparkle. Moreover it might be only three notes but they blend very elegantly. They stand alone beautifully.<br />
2. TRY IT ON FIRST. The other day I smelled it on a woman who was just passing by and it was terrible on her. A similar incident happened four months ago. Also if you are repurchasing try it on again. They have reformulated and it is a bit creamier and unfortunately sweeter. Make sure it suits you.<br />
3. It might be a springtime scent but it absolutely shines on me during late autumn. I'd say it's too floral for summer and too light for actual winter. <br />
4. If you like layering your perfumes: I might not usually like vanilla but it blends very nicely with minimal vanilla base perfumes. I'll let you know if I try anything else.<br />
<br />
I have associated this perfume with my early-mid 20s and even though I'm not crazy about it anymore (mainly because of the reformulation) it will always hold a special place in my heart. It's a Lana Del Ray song in a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1903285"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1903285#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903253" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1903253" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ver5"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1785336"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1785336.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ver5" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Gold-Oddity-89149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold Oddity"title="Gold Oddity"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1903253ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1903253" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1785336">ver5</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-16">08/16/23 00:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White floral lovers would really appreciate this perfume. Loved it when I first smelled it, but I think this perfume got boring really fast. I finished the whole bottle in 4-5 years. It smells nice, but there's something about it that doesn't make me feel excited to wear it. Lasted only around 3 hours on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1903253"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1903253#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1894682" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1894682" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sophiebebe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1808109"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sophiebebe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1894682ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1894682" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1894682"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1894682#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1891161" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1891161" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cheems"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1285988"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1285988.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cheems" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-Est-Belle-14982.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14982.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie Est Belle"title="La Vie Est Belle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1891161ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1891161" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1285988">Cheems</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-31">07/31/23 11:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The bottle is ugly and so is the smell. Not sure what happened because I used to LOVE this perfume… now it just doesn’t stand out to me at all and I cannot use it. It’s extremely linear, only smells like white florals and has become incredibly boring, not to mention that the amount of sweetness makes me kind of nauseous. I tried layering it with another vanilla perfume to see if I’d like it better and that was the wrong decision… it smelled so much worse. Just don’t bother, there are much better perfumes out there for better prices</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1891161"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1891161#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889142" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889142" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="that1makeupgirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/893154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="that1makeupgirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889142ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889142" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/893154">that1makeupgirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-28">07/28/23 10:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a yawn in a bottle. A shrug. Inoffensive, clean, floral, nothing special. Forgettable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1889142"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1889142#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1888506" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1888506" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toni64"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="toni64" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Calvin-Klein/Deep-Euphoria-39604.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39604.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Deep Euphoria"title="Deep Euphoria"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1888506ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1888506" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821189">toni64</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-27">07/27/23 17:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought Gucci Bloom when it was first released. Its a beautiful floral fragrance. On my skin it smells like it has honeysuckle in it ,must be the Rangoon creeper.<br />
It lasts all day. Great for spring /summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1888506"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1888506#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1886239" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1886239" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juliacassu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1712507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1712507.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juliacassu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roger-Gallet/Feuille-de-The-84598.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84598.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Feuille de Thé"title="Feuille de Thé"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1886239ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1886239" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1712507">juliacassu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-24">07/24/23 18:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a purely white floral scent, and I think it's quite beautiful. There's really no secret to it - you can probably imagine what it smells like if you are familiar with the notes. But it still surprising in performance. It's extremely feminine and very mature. It smells like a powerful woman would. A boss. <br />
I think white floral scents are a bit tricky. I sometimes hate white floral perfumes because I think they're nauseatingly sweet, but at the same time when done right it's one of my favorite scents, a fresher kind of sweet. Not fresh in the sense of aromatic, but I-just-picked-these-flowers fresh. Gucci Bloom is definitely a bundle of freshly picked sweet white flowers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1886239"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1886239#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1884471" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1884471" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hataruna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1439135"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1439135.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hataruna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Prada-Candy-L-Eau-17640.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17640.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Prada Candy L'Eau"title="Prada Candy L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1884471ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1884471" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1439135">hataruna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-22">07/22/23 09:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Granny-chic. With a heavy dose of white floral realism. Upon first spray in Ulta, I was transported to my grandmother’s lavatory. Crocheted cotton lace privacy curtains, porcelain soap dishes, cups, and jars all adorned with idyllic scenes, flowers, and vines. A second whiff and the realism becomes apparent. I get a cigarette note, which I’m guessing is the jasmine. Does anyone else get that too? I’ve now been transported to an outdoor cafe on a cobblestone street. The sun has dipped below the buildings, and the warmth and the evening has wafted the scent of a blooming jasmine vine over to our table as we chat. That slight cigarette note is what amps up the “outdoor cafe” vibes for me I think. For the summery scene I’ve described, ironically I can’t do this one when it’s too hot; goes too bubblegummy. The lasting power is atrocious, but it’s pretty while it’s here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1884471"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1884471#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880195" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880195" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Le-Parfum-61856.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61856.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male Le Parfum"title="Le Male Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880195ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880195" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-16">07/16/23 14:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#172 in my "Tour de Fragrance" and a sample I ordered by mistake because it was filtered as "unisex." It is most definitely not. This is pretty much like a floral scent my mother wore as long as I can remember. Not sure the brand but wouldn't surprise me if it were Avon. I really hated it and bought her some of the most expensive alternatives on the market. She gleefully swapped back and forth wearing the dozens of pieces of jewelry I bought her over the years, but never switched from that damn floral scent. She passed in 2007 at the age of 82 and that's pretty much the target age group for this fragrance. I passed this around three baristas at my favorite coffee spot, all early to mid-twenties, beautiful young women, and everyone pronounced it a "grandma scent" you'd expect to smell as a deodorizer in an extended care facility. I know Gucci doesn't get much love on this site, and I gotta admit I've given away most of the Gucci scents I've bought and don't plan on trying more, but this women's scent is just one note and it's a sad one. Maybe it would be suitable for layering in a white floral note with something that has more character, but maybe not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1880195"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1880195#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1879901" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1879901" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Joehoe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1779178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1779178.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Joehoe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Egoiste-Platinum-614.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.614.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Egoiste Platinum"title="Egoiste Platinum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1879901ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1879901" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);
