But when I mixed it with other jasmine/ rose fragrance .. wow ! Feminine touch.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1868099"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1868099#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1862904" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1862904" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Asaeli"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1720266"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Asaeli" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1862904ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1862904" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1720266">Asaeli</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-23">06/23/23 11:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’ve got Rangoon creeper oil with me it’s  smell like soap. Can someone confirm it’s this is real Rangoon creeper. It’s smells different than Gucci bloom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1862904"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1862904#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1862526" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1862526" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HannahRosesAreRed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1705684.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HannahRosesAreRed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Bubble-Bath-60105.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60105.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bubble Bath"title="Bubble Bath"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1862526ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1862526" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705684">HannahRosesAreRed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-22">06/22/23 19:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White floral bomb. That is Gucci Bloom in three words. <br />
<br />
This is the ultimate, the whitest, the most floral, the MOST WHITE FLORAL perfume ever. Although it officially only has three notes—jasmine, tuberose and Rangoon creeper—Gucci Bloom is quite potent. I can definitely smell hints of other white flowers here, such as orange blossom. Given how simple it is, it’s no surprise that Gucci Bloom is on the linear side—what you smell is what you get, from the opening to the drydown. No opening, no changing, no shift from top, middle or base notes. The tuberose and jasmine dominate, yet are equal partners. Surprisingly, despite white florals being notorious for offending either with their sweetness or indolic, animalic undertones, Gucci Bloom’s white florals lean more toward stye soapy, creamy or vanillic, at least on my skin.<br />
<br />
Longevity is so-so. I had only a small, single spritz on my arm and it lasted about three or four hours before it disappeared. Sillage is decent, a little less than arm’s length. I do rather like it—I live in an area where white florals, star jasmine and orange blossom bloom throughout spring into early summer, so I have come to love smelling these flowers in warm weather. I’m also partial to the opaque porcelain bottle.  I’d say, if you’re in the search of a pleasant, feminine, approachable, no-frills white floral, then Gucci Bloom is worth a shot.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1862526"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1862526#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1861376" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1861376" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lotte_Liese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508368"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1508368.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lotte_Liese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Armaf/Tres-Nuit-Valentina-94329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tres Nuit Valentina"title="Tres Nuit Valentina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1861376ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1861376" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508368">Lotte_Liese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-21">06/21/23 07:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love tuberose, but here it is both over- and under-done. Over done in its potency, underdone in the failure of the fragrance to gently open up tuberose and blend it in well with the jasmine note which is present, but often overwhelmed.<br />
I will shelve to retest in the winter, perhaps time will bring the notes together.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1861376"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1861376#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1859123" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1859123" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peachygal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541957"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="peachygal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Liz-Claiborne/Spark-3353.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3353.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spark"title="Spark"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1859123ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1859123" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541957">peachygal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-18">06/18/23 09:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one is all tuberose and jasmine. There is a bit of sweetness to it and it’s blended very well so neither note overpowers the other. <br />
<br />
I would have thought there were fruits in this because it does smell sweet to my nose but it doesn’t sound like there are any. <br />
<br />
It smells like the inside of a florist with some sweet fruits mixed in is the best way to describe this one. <br />
<br />
You have to be a big lover or tuberose and or jasmine to love this one and unfortunately I am not. Still a lovely perfume and I will enjoy my bottle.<br />
<br />
Performance is excellent I can smell myself hours after spraying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1859123"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1859123#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1847984" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1847984" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1847984ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1847984" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-03">06/03/23 07:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love both jasmine and tuberose, but the jasmine and tuberose notes don't smell naturalistic to my nose in this. It's cloyingly sweet and it gives me a bit of a headache and this is coming from someone who loves white florals!<br />
<br />
It also smells a bit too mainstream and not unique enough for my tastes I have to say.<br />
<br />
The longevity and sillage are good though and this isn't a bad perfume. Just nothing wonderful or different and definitely more synthetic smelling than natural smelling.<br />
<br />
6/10 for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1847984"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1847984#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1846782" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1846782" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lanascola"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1594003"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1594003.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lanascola" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1846782ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1846782" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1594003">Lanascola</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-01">06/01/23 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Granny in the best way possible, old money style. The tuberose gives it its hint of sweetness and rounds it off perfectly. Granted it's still a floral which i can imagine could get pretty heady if over-sprayed. Despite that, this is a great fragrance that is worth its price tag. Although i'd love to wear this myself i'm afraid i have not matured to it yet and this perfume thrives in sophistication.<br />
<br />
7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1846782"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1846782#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1844797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1844797" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="honeyedclover"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1758124"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1758124.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="honeyedclover" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Angel-Elixir-78581.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78581.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angel Elixir"title="Angel Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1844797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1844797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1758124">honeyedclover</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-30">05/30/23 00:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's beauty in simplicity, that is this perfume. The notes when applied are exactly what it says on the tin: definitively jasmine and tuberose, no surprises, not even in the dry-down. Personally, I am a big fan of jasmine and this just makes my heart flutter. An alluring bouquet you may sniff once or twice at first, but something pulls you back in as you indulge in getting multiple whiffs throughout the day. This is pretty safe if you're a floral lover. Bloom is simplistic yet sophisticated perhaps even a bit sensual. The only unfortunate part is that it doesn't last that long on me :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1844797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1844797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1837801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1837801" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Evelyn Elizabeth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1753977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Evelyn Elizabeth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Rose-N-Roses-58562.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58562.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Rose N'Roses"title="Miss Dior Rose N'Roses"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1837801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1837801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753977">Evelyn Elizabeth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-20">05/20/23 11:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a beautiful scent! It’s very soapy and a bit powdery. It definitely smells like a luxurious soap you get at a very expensive hotel. Weirdly enough, it kind of smells humid to my nose. It would be perfect for a wedding or a picnic. It’s not something I’d wear at night but that comes down to personal preference. It’s simple but it’s a gem. Sadly it doesn’t last long on me, it has only lasted up to 2 hours on my skin and 3-4 on my clothes. If you’re thinking of buying it, I’d definitely test it out in Sephora first and then wear it the entire day to see if it’ll last. I think I might invest in the dossier version to see if it’ll last longer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1837801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1837801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1836421" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1836421" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Night of April"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1599943"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1599943.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Night of April" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1836421ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1836421" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1599943">Night of April</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-18">05/18/23 15:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have both Gucci Bloom and Gucci Bloom Nettare di flori. I love both!<br />
I'd recommend "Bloom" if you love floral and subtle fragrances! The notes are exactky what you nose get once you spray it on your skin.<br />
I'd recommend "Nettare di flori" if you love floral but also want some sweetness and depth. I find that one to be more dimensional.<br />
<br />
But over all, both of them are so nice and gentle to the nose, you will feel like a princess of flowers with whatever of these!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1836421"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1836421#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1833932" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1833932" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="supremejasminefan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750571"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1750571.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="supremejasminefan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1833932ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1833932" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750571">supremejasminefan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-15">05/15/23 17:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's perfect for Radiohead fans: no alarms and no surprises. If you love photorealistic white florals, you will love it. If you're not sure about white florals, ohhh my god do not blind buy. <br />
<br />
Jasmine is my favorite note and this is my favorite interpretation of it. Simple? Yes, but that's what makes it so intoxicating. Bloom always gives me the mental image of being inside a magnolia flower, with their beautiful white, waxy petals. The scent is the perfect mix of defined, fresh, and comforting. It performs best as a warm-weather daytime perfume, but I wear it to bed whenever I'm having trouble sleeping just because of how comforting it is to me. I think jasmine is a familiar scent for many people, which makes this a great crowd-pleaser as well.<br />
<br />
The scent itself is linear, but at least on my skin, it seems to really come into itself after about 30 minutes and goes from being a bit too heady to perfectly fresh. I think it's best on the skin. I don't usually wear it on my clothes.<br />
<br />
The tuberose is similar enough for most people to jasmine that I would consider it a soliflore. If you want something with more complexity, check out the rest of the Bloom line. They have some gems!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1833932"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1833932#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1830570" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1830570" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maddieonline"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1719117"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1719117.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maddieonline" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1830570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1830570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1719117">maddieonline</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-11">05/11/23 11:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really really wanted to like this but it just smells bitter and acidic both in the bottle and even moreso on my skin. Definitely not for me :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1830570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1830570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1828082" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1828082" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HeatherMuffin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1671524"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1671524.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HeatherMuffin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1828082ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1828082" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1671524">HeatherMuffin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-08">05/08/23 17:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is spicy floral done right. It’s a mainstream scent that’s been done before, but gucci did it RIGHT. I absolutely love this and have been wearing it steady for a while. It smells so happy , like a beautiful flower crown of jasmine, Tuberose and Rangoon, floating on the golden hair of an elven princess on her afternoon wedding in her English castle gardens… in Rivendell, and she just hugged her grandma . Lol that’s the combo I get. And I love it. <br />
The dry down is what I’m super super deeply in love with. I spray Bloom on my clothes just to wear them later with the soft creamy dry down. <br />
<br />
This done not smell mature to me, but it does smell like the daughter or grand daughter of a mature fragrance. It smells sophisticated, but remains simple, and doesn’t take you on a stomach churning ride every time faking you out that it’s a floral, but it’s not! <br />
<br />
It’s not animalic like Do Son, it’s spicier than Grand Bal, it’s not as singular and intense as EL private collection Tuberose Gardenia. It lacks the Rose in Bloom Ambrosia. <br />
<br />
Rating my white florals: tied for first are grand Bal &amp; Bloom, third fave is bloom ambrosia &amp; EL Tuberose gardenia, fourth is Do Son edt (I don’t like EDP) I have carolina Herrera OG clear bottle, but I can’t even wear it I don’t know why, but it doesn’t count. It’s not bad, it’s just too much and maybe it’s too sweet. But perfume is funny like that. Also I have Lilac Path by Aerin and even though it’s a lilac perfume it is really quite heavy with the white florals, and if it’s in the ranking it’s up high, and has a bit of a warm vanilla base to it, just a soft one. And Honour is in my collection and is beautiful too, it’s more complex , which usually I do not prefer. It is quite toasty cozy with a hint of woody power under the soft delicate floral top and middle. It’s up there in the ranking, certainly but it’s not soli-flore enough to put with other white florals.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1828082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1828082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1823437" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1823437" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melis.t"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1308485"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1308485.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melis.t" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1823437ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1823437" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1308485">Melis.t</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-02">05/02/23 17:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is quite linear and heavy white floral scent. Here you experience the whole flower including stem, which gives bitter green nuances in an unpleasant way. That bitterness turns my stomach. Not something I would classify as modern and youthful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1823437"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1823437#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1822858" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1822858" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stylishchickenbone28"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740431"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="stylishchickenbone28" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1822858ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1822858" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740431">stylishchickenbone28</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-02">05/02/23 03:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gucci Bloom is a mainstream fragrance that clearly goes with the brand's aesthetic vision at the time. Gucci in 2017 was having a "70s everything" moment, and this clearly expresses that. While it's extremely simple to the nose, there's a bit going on that creates the effortlessly simple aroma. On the surface, there's a creamy white tuberose and a smooth jasmine. Looking a bit closer, there appears to be some sandalwood, white musk and maybe a little vanilla. The statement from chickenlittle that it smells like "death, in a feminine way" is both hilarious and (now that I've read that) quite true. <br />
<br />
A little bit of an add-on: Michael by Michael Kors is better, in my opinion but also quite similar. As boygirl suggests, perhaps this is great for layering with scents like that. I have a sample of that, so I might try. Will report back if I do.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1822858"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1822858#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1821032" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1821032" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="boygirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1363194"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1363194.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="boygirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lolita-Lempicka/L-de-Lolita-Lempicka-455.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.455.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L de Lolita Lempicka"title="L de Lolita Lempicka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1821032ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1821032" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1363194">boygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-29">04/29/23 17:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Green, grassy white floral. VERY strong. I started with one spray and could smell it on myself overwhelmingly for a while so decided to scrub since it was getting a bit headachey. If you love white floral and tuberose, this one is for you. Probably best for layering as it is pretty linear and one-note</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1821032"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1821032#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1819994" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
As for me, this is a no. <br />
Smelled lovely on paper strip hence decided to spray on my wrist. Alas, on me headache inducing vibe- as stated above tuberose and me aren't best friends--and way too linear. Being amber vanilla type of person, no surprise that this scent which consists of 3 flowers is not my thing. <br />
<br />
Reminds me like 90% of a scent I knew back in the 80ies, but for the life of me I can't remember which one it was.<br />
<br />
This is not bad though. For those who love tuberose, try it by all means.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1819994"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1819994#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1819190" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
