But in a flowery, feminine way. It is simple and tuberose-heavy, so if you like that then go for it. Reminds me of seasonal depression (but make it springtime). Makes me sad but at least I smell like an unkept garden.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1819164"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1819164#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1812910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1812910" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pinkbird7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212872"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pinkbird7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1812910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1812910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1212872">Pinkbird7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-19">04/19/23 16:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don’t understand the longevity complaints here.  I wore this yesterday and it stayed with me the entire day. Having just purchased it, I can’t say how long it lasts on clothes but I imagine it would be days as I could still smell it on my shirt this morning. Body chemistry is so weird. Lol. If you love tuberose and bit of green, it’s definitely worth a try. Its simplicity is definitely what attracted me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1812910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1812910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1811932" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1811932" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ayesharshd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1660000"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1660000.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ayesharshd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1811932ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1811932" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1660000">ayesharshd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-18">04/18/23 12:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't care about what anyone says. this is so beautiful to me! I'm probably not the target audience here (a 19-year-old who mainly likes gourmand/more "childish" scents) but MAN something about this fragrance is addictive. <br />
it's a very basic floral composition yet it's somehow different than other floral scents. you certainly get the jasmine and tuberose, which are blended amazingly to leave a soft/creamy and feminine scent trail. there's also an underlying earthy/green/fresh tone to this, which I love so much. it makes me feel very fresh/clean. this is the kind of perfume I'd throw on while wearing a cute spring dress/skirt. <br />
I know for a fact that this will be my go-to for the spring/summer. <br />
Also, you can try layering this with Bath and Body Works At the Beach lotion/mist (very coconut-heavy) to make it more "summery"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1811932"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1811932#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1809555" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1809555" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cowboygenesis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1706276"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1706276.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cowboygenesis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lolita-Lempicka/LolitaLand-51385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LolitaLand"title="LolitaLand"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1809555ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1809555" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1706276">cowboygenesis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-15">04/15/23 10:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a simple, refreshing scent fit for something like a casual date in the summertime. major emphasis on the 'simple', however. this perfume is remarkably unremarkable, especially considering the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1809555"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1809555#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1806856" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1806856" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EvaD4984"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1571070"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="EvaD4984" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1806856ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1806856" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1571070">EvaD4984</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-12">04/12/23 07:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In my opinion, this perfume is disgusting. Not a safe blind buy. I tested this in-store and it made me wince, the stench of funeral home filling the perfume aisle. I was literally gagging in the middle of the store because of how offensive this scent is to the nose. Weirdly enough, it reminds me of flowers on the edge of decay; not dead flowers, but week-old flowers left in the sun. Uncomfortably warm and sickly sweet with an underlying rotten smell, something is just "off" with this funky fragrance. <br />
<br />
It is very heavy on the tuberose so if you hate tuberose, avoid this monstrosity. If you really love tuberose and classic florals, then this actually might be for you because many people seem to love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1806856"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1806856#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1804984" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1804984" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PKSMKE"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322968"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1322968.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PKSMKE" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Sheikh-Al-Shuyukh-Luxe-Edition-31327.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31327.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sheikh Al Shuyukh Luxe Edition"title="Sheikh Al Shuyukh Luxe Edition"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1804984ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1804984" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1322968">PKSMKE</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-09">04/09/23 21:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not a safe blind buy, and turns sour and unpleasant in the drydown. Ugh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1804984"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1804984#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1804152" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1804152" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="call me zi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1718819"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="call me zi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1804152ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1804152" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1718819">call me zi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-08">04/08/23 18:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought this couple years ago. I really liked the scent in the store, but when I started to use it I hated it. A couple hours after spraying it on it just had a nasty smell. I really felt uncomfortable wearing this. I gave it some chances but was disappointed each time. <br />
<br />
And also: the packaging feels so cheap. <br />
<br />
I didn't like it. Maybe spray it on and walk in it for a couple hours before buying it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1804152"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1804152#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1801156" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1801156" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="faunathon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1661083"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1661083.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="faunathon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1801156ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1801156" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1661083">faunathon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-05">04/05/23 09:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This reminds me of the Empress card in the tarot. Luminous, lush, potent, and richly feminine. <br />
<br />
I bought this on the spot while I was passing a long layover in an airport perfume store. The bottles for the recent Gucci fragrances are so gorgeous and I made my way through smelling them all, mostly being unimpressed. This one smelled so different from the rest; I immediately swooned.<br />
<br />
It's a photorealistic tuberose. You just literally smell like a creamy, hypnotic, gorgeous tuberose blossom. On me, it's a soliflore and pretty linear, but I consider those things to be refreshing perks if they're done really well (if I love a scent, why wouldn't I want to keep smelling that way instead of drying down to a generic vanilla or wood?). Bloom does these things very well. <br />
<br />
I tend to use just one spray and it stays with me all day. Mellows down nicely, the dry-down isn't super sweet and doesn't surprise you with anything old-ladyish. I just love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1801156"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1801156#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1798952" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1798952" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="saho93"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1630728"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1630728.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="saho93" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1798952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1798952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1630728">saho93</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-02">04/02/23 17:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>True to description. Burst of jasmine ( in the sense of perfume jasmine, not real jasmine) then it stays tubersose. Competently done. I think my preference is between fresh aquatic and lush—a perfect balance that dances to your soul. Not sure this does that, but it is competently formulated in a mechanical way that lacks human mastery.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1798952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1798952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1795384" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1795384" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="autumnblue914"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1689395"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="autumnblue914" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1795384ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1795384" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1689395">autumnblue914</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-29">03/29/23 06:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pure tuberose with creamy jasmine. A basic but effective scent that is suitable for every day and for work. I like it but I would still prefer something like this with a little something else added. There's beauty in simplicity and this succeeds in what it tries to be, but I'd like a tiny bit more complexity. It would still be basic but it would have a small uniqueness to it. Still conveying and putting the spotlight on the white florals, while having something support them in the background. But maybe that's just me. <br />
<br />
I think for what it is and for the simplicity of it the price is outrageous though. <br />
<br />
Pleasant, refreshing.<br />
<br />
<br />
SKIN UPDATE: <br />
I do have to note that here in the first few minutes if I smell it on my skin, rather than in the air, there is a slight stink-like smell in the background. Exactly the same one as the one I get in Jil Sander No. 4. I originally thought that was due to the civet note but now I don't think so anymore. Both Jil Sander and Gucci are owned by Coty and No. 4 has a dominant note of jasmine. So my theory - Coty uses the same jasmine accord which on my skin ends up slightly stinky for the first few minutes, unless smelled in the air. So keep that in mind I suppose.<br />
<br />
Or it could be the tuberose too tbh. It's one of those. They both have it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1795384"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1795384#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1794898" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1794898" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nanalvzpink"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370343"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1370343.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nanalvzpink" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Lost-Cherry-51411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lost Cherry"title="Lost Cherry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1794898ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1794898" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370343">Nanalvzpink</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-28">03/28/23 12:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Vintage flower vibe.<br />
It’s smells beautiful after 3 hours, but I don’t want to wait 3 hours to actually love my perfume, so this won’t be in my collection. <br />
<br />
However, this perfume provides a beautiful scent trail and very long wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1794898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1794898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1794770" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1794770" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lucccx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1706582"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lucccx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1794770ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1794770" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1706582">lucccx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-28">03/28/23 09:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was the first perfume I ever purchased, I fell in love with it immediately. It's a simple, floral scent, very elegant and lasts long. Maybe a little bit on the heavier side.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1794770"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1794770#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1793476" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1793476" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="agejo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1692958"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1692958.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="agejo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Salvatore-Ferragamo/Oceani-di-Seta-66365.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66365.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oceani di Seta"title="Oceani di Seta"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1793476ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1793476" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1692958">agejo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-26">03/26/23 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>not a fan of very light, floral fragrances, but this one stood out to me. very simple, i like it. not a fan of gucci, considering their perfumes are so expensive (my wallet is crying), but this one is nice. it is... very, very weak though. could only smell it on myself for less than an hour... other than that, it's one that i like, only a little though. cute bottle too, the pink is gorgeous, really fits the fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1793476"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1793476#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1792898" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1792898" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JolieSucre"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1233265"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1233265.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JolieSucre" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Carolina-Herrera/Good-Girl-39681.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39681.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Good Girl"title="Good Girl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1792898ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1792898" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1233265">JolieSucre</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-26">03/26/23 04:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Honestly this perfume reminds me of 5th Avenue (70%) and 5th Avenue NYC Vibe (90%) by Elizabeth Arden. It's almost identical, minus the coconut note in that one (which is slightly sweeter). Maybe also a bit of J'Adore, it's that kind of fragrance ... but without the pear /fruity notes, it's a bit too linear.<br />
<br />
It's a beautiful fragrance but just a simple floral. Reminds me of the florals of the early 2000s, before the sugar bombs appeared. I think Paris Hilton, or even Coco Mademoiselle (without the pepper, musk etc. whatever makes that one slightly pungent to my nose).<br />
<br />
As other reviewers have said, it's a clean, bright fragrance that does conjure images of 'bridal' and white.. it isn't soapy or anything, just clean and linear.<br />
<br />
For the record I have Michael Kors' OG fragrance and Kim Kardashian's first fragrance (both identical) that are both based on tuberose and this one has the slightest note in it, not tuberose-y at all, unlike the other two which are very strong on the tuberose note.<br />
<br />
Same with Lush's Jasmine perfume. That one is thick and oily and has a distinct benzoic note, like mothballs, mixed with the jasmine. I can't detect anything of the sort in this one, not even the jasmine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1792898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1792898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1792760" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1792760" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bunnysalvatore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434672"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1434672.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bunnysalvatore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1792760ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1792760" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); Beautiful jasmine scent which settles really nicely throughout the day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1792760"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1792760#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784674" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1784674" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Spicadk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1687795"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1687795.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Spicadk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1784674ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1784674" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); Smell like real roses. Its warm, powdery, dry</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1784674"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1784674#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1780033" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1780033" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jazzscent13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695061"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1695061.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jazzscent13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Si-Intense-2021-64853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sì Intense 2021"title="Sì Intense 2021"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1780033ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1780033" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1695061">jazzscent13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-10">03/10/23 09:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’m surprised vanilla isn’t listed. But my guess is that the tuberose is a buttery tuberose. It’s a very green tuberose in the opening, but once it settles on the skin, it becomes an earthy-vanilla, white floral  scent. If you can get through the opening, then it’s actually pretty good. <br />
It took awhile to grow on me.  But I want this for layering. This has a retro vibe. Like 1970s/80s Gucci ecstatic. This is not a safe blind buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1780033"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1780033#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1774683" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1774683" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lmnsvgz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259533.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lmnsvgz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Histoires-de-Parfums/1969-Parfum-de-Revolte-4492.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4492.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1969 Parfum de Revolte"title="1969 Parfum de Revolte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1774683ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1774683" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533">lmnsvgz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-04">03/04/23 05:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a GRANDMA scent. Hell, even my grandmother prefers more modern scents. It is not soapy, it is not sweet, it just smells dated.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1774683"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1774683#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1773473" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1773473" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Autumn_Moon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1496569"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1496569.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Autumn_Moon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Unknown-Pleasures-17438.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17438.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unknown Pleasures"title="Unknown Pleasures"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1773473ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1773473" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1496569">Autumn_Moon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-02">03/02/23 17:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you are in search of a linear, modern floral, this one might fit the bill.<br />
<br />
I experience a fairly constant blend of jasmine and tuberose when I wear this -- equally balanced, and not skanky.  It's office-friendly (i.e. not dirty, carnal, or any of the other adjectives that can be applied to those gorgeous white flowers, depending upon the nature of their presentation in a fragrance -- if you want "dirty" jasmine, try Lush's Lust), projects moderately, and develops in a linear fashion.  What you spray is what you get; there are few (or no) surprises here.<br />
<br />
I like it.  I truly do.  I don't *love* it, but I *like* it.  I'd happily accept it if someone gave me a bottle.  It's an "easy reach" fragrance; you'll smell pleasant while wearing it, you'll probably enjoy the experience, and you're not likely to cause offense to others.    <br />
<br />
When it comes to the idea of purchasing this, though, I'm on the fence.  I *do* enjoy it.  If it were offered in a 10ml travel spray (as opposed to a rollerball, which I personally dislike), I might be tempted to give this perfume an extended test run.  Do I want to invest in a larger amount at this time?  Hmmmm... not quite yet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1773473"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1773473#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1772896" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1772896" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sagittarius_energyyy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1697856"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1697856.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sagittarius_energyyy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1772896ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1772896" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1697856">Sagittarius_energyyy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-02">03/02/23 04:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I describe this scent in a positive way, it’s not overwhelming, smells like actual flowers (not artificial), you can wear this everyday/anywhere, and no one’s gonna hate this smell on you. <br />
<br />
Now, to be brutally honest, it’s BORING as hell. Just flower. That’s it. And it doesn’t even last long.<br />
<br />
 If I describe this scent as a person, she is pretty and nice to everyone but no one really seems to care or be intimidated (in a good way) bout her presence. She doesn’t have any personality or charms. <br />
Are you a boring person? Buy this to match ur personality</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1772896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1772896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1768591" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1768591" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smccmurphy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545962"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1545962.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smccmurphy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Liquides-Imaginaires/Blanche-Bete-70189.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70189.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche Bête"title="Blanche Bête"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1768591ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1768591" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545962">smccmurphy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-24">02/24/23 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty, light tuberose. There are cheaper, longer lasting options out there though that smell very similar in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1768591"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1768591#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1765996" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1765996" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SaraSeven"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1556302"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1556302.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SaraSeven" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mitsouko-Eau-de-Parfum-25316.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25316.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mitsouko Eau de Parfum"title="Mitsouko Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1765996ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1765996" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1556302">SaraSeven</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-21">02/21/23 19:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bloom is a lovely white floral scent. I wish it had a little more dimension, but if you are a fan of linear florals, I do think this is a nice option. I think I would personally be more likely to pair this with another perfume than wear it on it's own. I'm thinking Musc Ravageur might pair nicely on top of this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1765996"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1765996#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1764265" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1764265" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ssamhita"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1420430"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1420430.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ssamhita" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nina-Ricci/L-Air-du-Temps-A-Paris-Chez-Antoinette-Poisson-Edition-Limitee-2022-73224.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73224.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Air du Temps À Paris Chez Antoinette Poisson Edition Limitee 2022"title="L'Air du Temps À Paris Chez Antoinette Poisson Edition Limitee 2022"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1764265ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1764265" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1420430">ssamhita</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-19">02/19/23 20:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first time I smelled this on my sister, I told her, "You smell like a bride". I'm from Assam in India (yes, the home of Assam tea) and growing up, brides would wear strands of tuberose on their hair. There would be tuberose garlands decorating the venue as well, and weddings would not be complete without that heady intoxicating scent perfuming the air. I know Gucci Bloom is touted as a jasmine scent, but having grown up among jasmine bushes and tuberose plants, I assure you this is as close to a real tuberose as it gets. I love that this isn't sweetened like every other white floral these days. This is white through and through, and warm and creamy as opposed to soapy. It doesn't have to be anything else. <br />
<br />
When my sister gifted me a bottle, I was beyond joyous. I wore it to watch a movie with my friend. After a while she started sniffing the air around us and said, "Someone's wearing a floral hair oil." I was heartbroken when we established it was indeed me. I set the bottle aside for the longest time, and then a few months ago, swapped it for the Narciso Eau de Toilette (the black cube) I didn't think much of it because I knew that one is getting harder and harder to find. <br />
<br />
But then again, I realised I was craving the heady tuberose scent. I think it must because I smelled that Bath and Body Works mist, Fresh Gardenia, which again is a beautiful realistic white floral that is gone in seconds. What do you know, I hunted down a bigger bottle of Gucci Bloom, and am basking in its soft white cloud today. <br />
<br />
Having been on both sides of this one, I do understand the comments about it being headache inducing. Because guess what, real tuberoses are potentially headache inducing too. In fact, two stalks in a vase in a living room has the potential to choke out the room. But that's the thing about white florals, right? They don't have a lot going on for them in terms of colour which is why they need to make up for it with their heady perfumes. <br />
<br />
I am glad I took my time with this one, and honestly, I have zero regrets about swapping it because now I have two perfumes that I know for sure I love. Longevity in this one could be better given how strong it opens, so I wouldn't wear it on days when I know I will be outside for long hours, but if you're like me and staying at home or going out for short errands, I think this is a delightful way of sparking instant joy with just three spritzes every now and then.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1764265"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1764265#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1761134" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1761134" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ieemelon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1684856"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1684856.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ieemelon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1761134ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1761134" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1684856">ieemelon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-15">02/15/23 21:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm testing this fragrance on myself today, and honestly I love it. From start to finish, lovely floral scents cover you with mostly the Jasmine coming through. It feels as though you are laying in a bed of flowers, so feminine and comforting. Simple, elegant but unique, I think this perfume is perfect for everyday wear in Spring. I just wish it lasted longer, it starts fading slightly about 2 hours in, but overall lasted about 5 hours, with barely any trace left by hour 5.<br />
I think I prefer the Gucci Bloom Nettare di Fiori better as it's more complex, less sweet and more herby, but Gucci Bloom stands on its own very well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="44894"comment_id="1761134"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Bloom-44894.html?ccid=1761134#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1757726" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
